CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 14 In particular , Guo et al. reported that OFETs based on a phthalimide - containing polythiophene exhibited hole mobilities of ∼ 0.2 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 under ambient conditions without optimization. 14 Thiophene imide has simple , compact , symmetric , and planar structure. It could promote intrachain and interchain interactions along and between coplanar polymer chains. Zhang et al. pioneered to use thiophene imide as a building block in conjugated polymers. 15,16 Later , thiophene imide homopolymers were synthesized. 17-19 Recently , polymer solar cells based on blends of copolymers of thiophene imide and benzodithiophene 20-23 or cyclopentadithiophene 24 with soluble fullerene derivatives PC71BM or PC61BM exhibited PCEs of 3-6.8 % . Wudl et al. reported low - bandgap conjugated polymers based on thiophene - fused phthalimide , i.e. , isothianaphthene imides ( 5 , Figure 1 ). 25,26 2,2 0 -Bithiophene-3,3 0 -dicarboximide ( BTI , 6 , Figure 1 ) with π-core planarity , antiparallel BTI packing , a short cofacial π-π distance of 3.43 Å , and a favorable solubilizing group orientation is a promising building block in n - type polymers. 27 Facchetti et al. reported that n-channel OFET based on a bithiophene imide homopolymer exhibited a μ e of 1.1 x 10^-2 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 , I on / I off of 2 x 10^7 , and a high V th ( 75 V ) in vacuum after annealing process at 240 ° C. 27 The fused - ring system can maximize the π-orbital overlap by restricting intramolecular rotation in the oligomer and possibly to induce face - to - face π-stacking , facilitating charge transport through intermolecular hopping. On the other hand , the fused rings can make the polymer backbone more rigid and coplanar , therefore enhancing effective π-conjugation , lowering bandgap , and extending absorption. 28-31 Therefore , fused - ring building blocks are widely used in synthesis of conjugated polymers. 32-34 For example , the large planar benzodithiophene ( BDT ) unit has emerged as an attractive building block for conjugated polymers. 35 Benzo[2,1-b:3,4-b 0 ]dithiophene ( 7 , Figure 2 ) with a curved structure prevents a fully conjugated pathway between substituents at the 2-and 6-positions. Hence , delocalization of the conjugated π-electron system along the copolymer backbone is disfavored by the incorporation of this unit. This increases the ionization potential of the polymer and is thus expected to improve air stability under operation. Additionally , compared to a single thiophene ring , it must be pointed out that due to the large resonance stabilization energy of BDT , the delocalization of electrons from the BDT unit into the backbone is less favorable than from the thiophene ring. As a result , a more stable copolymer with high performance can be obtained by using BDT as the core unit. OFETs based on a benzo[2,1-b:3,4-b 0 ]dithiophene copolymer manufactured on flexible substrate exhibited high hole mobility of 0.5 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 when the source-gate voltage is increased to 60 V.

Let's think step by step.

1. Phthalimide-containing polythiophene
2. Thiophene imide
3. Copolymers of thiophene imide and benzodithiophene
4. Cyclopentadithiophene
5. Isothianaphthene imides
6. 2,2'-Bithiophene-3,3'-dicarboximide (BTI)
7. Benzodithiophene (BDT)
8. Benzo[2,1-b:3,4-b'0]dithiophene (7)

These are the material names mentioned in the paragraph.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

1. Phthalimide-containing polythiophene
2. Thiophene imide
3. Copolymers of thiophene imide and benzodithiophene
4. Cyclopentadithiophene
5. Isothianaphthene imides
6. 2,2'-Bithiophene-3,3'-dicarboximide (BTI)
7. Benzodithiophene (BDT)
8. Benzo[2,1-b:3,4-b'0]dithiophene (7)

These are the entities that clearly refer to material names in the paragraph. I have removed any entities that could be interpreted as something other than material names.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| --- |
| Phthalimide-containing polythiophene |
| Thiophene imide |
| Copolymers of thiophene imide and benzodithiophene |
| Cyclopentadithiophene |
| Isothianaphthene imides |
| 2,2'-Bithiophene-3,3'-dicarboximide (BTI) |
| Benzodithiophene (BDT) |
| Benzo[2,1-b:3,4-b'0]dithiophene (7) |

On the other hand , the fused rings can make the polymer backbone more rigid and coplanar , therefore enhancing effective π-conjugation , lowering bandgap , and extending absorption. 28-31 Therefore , fused - ring building blocks are widely used in synthesis of conjugated polymers. 32-34 For example , the large planar benzodithiophene ( BDT ) unit has emerged as an attractive building block for conjugated polymers. 35 Benzo[2,1-b:3,4-b 0 ]dithiophene ( 7 , Figure 2 ) with a curved structure prevents a fully conjugated pathway between substituents at the 2-and 6-positions. Hence , delocalization of the conjugated π-electron system along the copolymer backbone is disfavored by the incorporation of this unit. This increases the ionization potential of the polymer and is thus expected to improve air stability under operation. Additionally , compared to a single thiophene ring , it must be pointed out that due to the large resonance stabilization energy of BDT , the delocalization of electrons from the BDT unit into the backbone is less favorable than from the thiophene ring. Let's think step by step.

1. Phthalimide-containing polythiophene
2. Thiophene imide
3. Coplanar polymer chains
4. Thiophene imide homopolymers
5. Benzodithiophene
6. Cyclopentadithiophene
7. Soluble fullerene derivatives PC71BM or PC61BM
8. Isothianaphthene imides
9. Bithiophene-3,3-dicarboximide (BTI)
10. N-type polymers
1
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Property Name of Material.

1. Phthalimide-containing polythiophene (property: hole mobilities)
2. Thiophene imide (property: structure, ability to promote intrachain and interchain interactions)
3. Coplanar polymer chains (property: ability to promote intrachain and interchain interactions)
4. Thiophene imide homopolymers (property: not specified)
5. Benzodithiophene (property: not specified)
6. Cyclopentadithiophene (property: not specified)
7. Soluble fullerene derivatives PC71BM or PC61BM (property: not specified)
8. Isothianaphthene imides (property: not specified)
9. Bithiophene-3,3-dicarboximide (BTI) (property: π-core planarity, antiparallel BTI packing, π-π distance, solubilizing group orientation)
10. N-type polymers (property: not specified)
11. Benzo[2,1-b:3,4-b ]dithiophene (BDT) (property: planar structure, ability to prevent a fully conjugated pathway, resonance stabilization energy)
12. Copolymer backbone (property: ability to delocalize π-electrons, ionization potential)

PV.content:
Please identify the Values (number + unit) of material properties in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 14 In particular , Guo et al. reported that OFETs based on a phthalimide - containing polythiophene exhibited hole mobilities of ∼ 0.2 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 under ambient conditions without optimization. 14 Thiophene imide has simple , compact , symmetric , and planar structure. It could promote intrachain and interchain interactions along and between coplanar polymer chains. Zhang et al. pioneered to use thiophene imide as a building block in conjugated polymers. 15,16 Later , thiophene imide homopolymers were synthesized. 17-19 Recently , polymer solar cells based on blends of copolymers of thiophene imide and benzodithiophene 20-23 or cyclopentadithiophene 24 with soluble fullerene derivatives PC71BM or PC61BM exhibited PCEs of 3-6.8 % . Wudl et al. reported low - bandgap conjugated polymers based on thiophene - fused phthalimide , i.e. , isothianaphthene imides ( 5 , Figure 1 ). 25,26 2,2 0 -Bithiophene-3,3 0 -dicarboximide ( BTI , 6 , Figure 1 ) with π-core planarity , antiparallel BTI packing , a short cofacial π-π distance of 3.43 Å , and a favorable solubilizing group orientation is a promising building block in n - type polymers. 27 Facchetti et al. reported that n-channel OFET based on a bithiophene imide homopolymer exhibited a μ e of 1.1 x 10^-2 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 , I on / I off of 2 x 10^7 , and a high V th ( 75 V ) in vacuum after annealing process at 240 ° C. 27 The fused - ring system can maximize the π-orbital overlap by restricting intramolecular rotation in the oligomer and possibly to induce face - to - face π-stacking , facilitating charge transport through intermolecular hopping. On the other hand , the fused rings can make the polymer backbone more rigid and coplanar , therefore enhancing effective π-conjugation , lowering bandgap , and extending absorption. 28-31 Therefore , fused - ring building blocks are widely used in synthesis of conjugated polymers. 32-34 For example , the large planar benzodithiophene ( BDT ) unit has emerged as an attractive building block for conjugated polymers. 35 Benzo[2,1-b:3,4-b 0 ]dithiophene ( 7 , Figure 2 ) with a curved structure prevents a fully conjugated pathway between substituents at the 2-and 6-positions. Hence , delocalization of the conjugated π-electron system along the copolymer backbone is disfavored by the incorporation of this unit. This increases the ionization potential of the polymer and is thus expected to improve air stability under operation. Additionally , compared to a single thiophene ring , it must be pointed out that due to the large resonance stabilization energy of BDT , the delocalization of electrons from the BDT unit into the backbone is less favorable than from the thiophene ring. As a result , a more stable copolymer with high performance can be obtained by using BDT as the core unit. OFETs based on a benzo[2,1-b:3,4-b 0 ]dithiophene copolymer manufactured on flexible substrate exhibited high hole mobility of 0.5 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 when the source-gate voltage is increased to 60 V.

Let's think step by step.

1. Hole mobilities of ~0.2 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1 (under ambient conditions without optimization)
2. A coplanar polymer chains structure that promotes intrachain and interchain interactions (no specific value or unit given)
3. PCEs (Power Conversion Efficiencies) of 3-6.8% (for polymer solar cells based on blends of copolymers of thiophene imide and benzodithiophene or cyclopentadithiophene with soluble fullerene derivatives PC71BM or PC61BM)
4. A short cofacial π-π distance of 3.43 Å (for 2,2'-Bithiophene-3,3'-dicarboximide)
5. A μe (electron mobility) of 1.1 x 10^-2 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1 (for n-channel OFET based on a bithiophene imide homopolymer)
6. A Vth (threshold voltage) of 75 V (for n-channel OFET based on a bithiophene imide homopolymer)
7. Hole mobility of 0.5 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1 (for OFETs based on a benzo[2,1-b:3,4-b']dithiophene copolymer manufactured on flexible substrate with source-gate voltage increased to 60 V)

Note: Some of the values are ranges, and some are specific values. Also, some values are dependent on certain conditions, such as temperature or applied voltage.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

1. Hole mobilities of ~0.2 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1
2. PCEs of 3-6.8%
3. A short cofacial π-π distance of 3.43 Å
4. A μe of 1.1 x 10^-2 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1
5. A Vth of 75 V
6. Hole mobility of 0.5 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1

Note: I have removed the entities that are not clearly referring to the value of a material property.

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| PCEs of 3-6.8 % (for polymer solar cells based on blends of copolymers of thiophene imide and benzodithiophene or cyclopentadithiophene with soluble fullerene derivatives PC71BM or PC61BM) |
| A short cofacial π-π distance of 3.43 Å (for 2,2'-Bithiophene-3,3'-dicarboximide) |
| A μe of 1.1 x 10^-2 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1 (for n-channel OFET based on a bithiophene imide homopolymer) |
| A Vth of 75 V (for n-channel OFET based on a bithiophene imide homopolymer) |
